revised_title: A Remarkable Fossil: Orthoceratites Discovery and Description
tldr: Edward Wright discovered a large Orthoceratites fossil in a marble table in Ghent. The fossil measures two feet four inches and 7-10ths in length and has sixty-six distinct partitions. The Orthoceratites is a rare and intriguing fossil, resembling the concamerated partitions of nautili but never found in its recent state. The fossil's discovery and description provide valuable insights into the study of paleontology and natural history.
